titles.title: A bill to make certain members of foreign diplomatic missions and consular posts in the United States subject to the criminal jurisdiction of the United States with respect to crimes of violence.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Hearings held.

bill.summary: 6/26/1987--Introduced. Provides that members of a foreign diplomatic mission (other than diplomatic agents) and members of a foreign consular post (other than consular officers) shall not be entitled to immunity from the criminal jurisdiction of the United States or of any State for: (1) any crime of violence; (2) drug trafficking; (3) reckless driving; or (4) driving while intoxicated or under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
